Lighting Upgrades

That Enhance Driving Safety
 
Get new lights
 

Winter is a dark season.

 

It’s dark when you leave for work and when you head back home. What makes it worse is that Mother Nature often throws rain and snow at us. Luckily, if you have proper automotive lighting for the winter and know how to use it, you get one step closer to driving safely and confidently

 
Get new lights
 

Ways to improve your visibility
 

There Are 3 Things To Remember:

 
 

Clean Frequently
 

You should clean your headlights, tail lights and signal lights more often; even if you think they don’t need it. The wintry mix of sand, road salt, and snow can drastically impair the effectiveness of your lights long after the last snowstorm.
 

Use Efficiently
 

Drive with low beam headlights on rather than high beams. First off, they will not reflect from snow and cause glare during a snowstorm. Secondly, when driving in urban and metropolitan areas, they will not blind oncoming drivers.
 

Upgrade Wisely
 

If your factory lights are not bright enough, consider an upgrade to something more efficient. You can install replacement LED or HID bulbs, or upgrade your complete headlight/taillight assemblies to projector style housing or LED lights. .
